contextId.information: The word "brothers" here refers to men and women believers. AT: "believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
The word "brothers" refers to men and women believers. AT: "left the fellow believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])

The word "brothers" here refers to men and women believers. You can make explicit that these are believers in Ephesus. AT: "fellow believers in Ephesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "brothers" refers to the believers in Jerusalem whether male or female. AT: "the fellow believers welcomed us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
These were followers of Jesus, including both men and women. AT: "fellow believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
